message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LO, cs.IT, cs.PL, cs.SE 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the formal definitions and complexity of quantitative information flow, which is a topic in computer security and privacy. The use of information theoretic notions such as entropy and channel capacity suggests a connection to information theory (cs.IT). The study of the bounding problem and its complexity makes it relevant to the area of computational complexity (cs.CC) and logic in computer science (cs.LO). The focus on loop-free boolean programs suggests a connection to programming languages (cs.PL) and software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the use of non-interference as a comparison point suggests a connection to cryptography (cs.CR).
